intro: Jonesia declinata, commonly known as the drooping jonesia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four petals and are clustered in umbels. Jonesia declinata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
